Reason: The 'compaction_throughput_mb_per_sec' configuration in the Cassandra project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the speed and efficiency of data compaction processes. A higher value for this configuration can lead to faster compaction but may also increase resource utilization, potentially affecting overall system performance. Conversely, a lower value may result in slower compaction and potential bottlenecks in data processing, impacting system performance as well.
